reviews.text: We were actually supposed to stay at the Cai de Conti which is the sister property to this, but it's hot water was bust, so they sent us here. We were very happy with the switch, as the location is quite good...5 mins from Rialto and 10 from San Marco with lots of great little stores and eateries in between. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms lovely. A lounge area separate from the bedroom with a great bathroom etc. We did have some sort of problem with the heating on the 2nd night, but not enough to worry us too much. Breakfast was okay, nothing fancy, but did the trick. Overall, a great hotel with lovely staff. Very comfortable.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Santa Marina overlooks a small square in a fairly pleasant, residential district, but just a few minutes from the Rialto and from San Giavanno and Paolo's basilica. Like much of Venice, it isn't that easy to find from a map (as a Geography graduate, I can read maps!), but on enquiring, a kind Venetian showed us the way.
reviews.title: Well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel...unfortunately they sent us to the dark, dreary, small and undecorated annex across the square. This was a total surprise and disappointment. There was no elevator and no natural light. It was also very loud (garbage men early in the morning) since it was near a side canal.
reviews.title: Scammed by the Annex

reviews.text: the hotel was excellent! the staff could not do enough to help you very friendly! the rooms were above average very comfortable! it was clean and we had a great stay! we took my mum there for her 60th birthday we had our beds turned down every night and chocolates on our pillows i would reccomend this hotel and we hope to go back in the future!
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: This was my second trip to Venice and, although the hotel I stayed in last time (Fremont Manin) was great, it was unavailable so we booked this one. I was a little apprehensive having read the horror stories about the 'secret annex' so I rang the hotel beforehand and asked for a room in the main building - which is what we got. We were in a ground floor room which overlooked a little court-yard in the centre of the hotel. There were tables and chairs in there but as it is uncovered and it was still cold in the evenings, hardly anyone use it so our room was really quiet. I think I would be wary of having a room this side in summer however, as I imagine a lot of people would sit in there having drinks in the evening and it would be noisy.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - great location

reviews.text: The hotel is very charming and immaculate and the rooms are lovely and spotlessly clean. The shower tray is on the floor and my friend managed to flood the bathroom the first night (which made me giggle as it had stayed dry when I was in there). What was even funnier was that she pulled an emergency cord thinking it was a ventilator and the alarms went off. There was a knock at the door and I opened it but hid behind the door as my friend emerged in a towel, hair soaking wet and offering her apologies for setting off the alarms! Very funny.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel is located very close to the Rialto Bridge. The service was fine. The room and the bathroom were very small, but we were expecting that already from a Venice hotel. Besides being tiny, the room was confortable and clean. The breakfast was excellent. We got a good price for this room (around USD $100), which is not expensive for its location.
reviews.title: Cozy Hotel in Venice's heart

reviews.text: The front desk staff bickered publicly the entire time we were there. There was not enough room to walk around the bed. Breakfast was meager and the furnishings were overdone. Air conditioner worked great due to the miniscule size of the room. Flat screen TV was nice.
reviews.title: Rude service and teeny tiny rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned yesterday from a stay at the Santa Marina, which concluded a 2 week trip across Italy. I have read some of the terrible reviews, and just wanted to say we had a lovely stay at this hotel. We were also put in the other building across the square, but found it to be quiet and relaxing. The hotel location is excellent--close to everything but far enough away so that you get a good night's sleep. Unlike Rome and even Sienna, where our rooms were more expensive, we were finally able to rest through the night without any noise. The hotel lobby is beautiful and the breakfast is great--get the hot chocolate. Overall, a very pleasant stay and would recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Santa Marina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent two nights at Hotel Santa Marina (May 25-27th, 2007) and paid over US$600 per night including breakfast. Our room was in the main building and much below our expectations. The room was small, had run down furniture, had mold on the walls and almost no amenities other than soap. We had to request toilet paper. The conscierge refused to help us with dinner reservations upon our arrival on May 25th and was very rude. We were practically told that we were on our own. The breakfast was Continental and ordinary. This hotel deserves a one star rating and definitely NOT worth over US$600 a night. There is no elevator and you may have to climb to your floor as we did on a very narrow stairway. The property is off the beaten path and therefore, relatively quiet compared to other locations in Venice. As world travelers we would rank this hotel as much overpriced for what it offers.
reviews.title: Terribly overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in April on an Airmiles trip because it was 4 star and near everything. When we got there we were dumped on the top floor of a ghastly annexe up the road in a room like a shoe box. You could barely get in and out the shower. They said it was all they had, so we hadn't much option.
reviews.title: Avoid the annexe and don't listen when they lie about the aircon
